title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: November 3
body:
Morning folks,

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get put delayed or even stopped.
If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Pre-Season just around the corner**

Bit of a quiet before the storm period for us at the moment. We've just recently locked down the final changes of the pre-season patch and are extremely excited to see it go out after working for a long time on Runes. The second half of next week onwards is likely to be really busy again as we make needed adjustments based off how Runes etc are performing, looking forward to talking about our thoughts on that. For now though there's a bit less to discuss so a brief period of comparative quiet. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**More Word Clouds**

The last set seemed pretty well received with a number of people asking to see some more, so I figured I'd throw some extras in here. As before this is hopefully a mixture of the instantly recognizeable and the harder to immediately identify. Most of these clouds are also a different format to the ones from Wednesday's post. The first one here, and the ones from Wednesday are based off a general survey that asks what players associate with a champion. The other new ones by contrast ask specifically what players feel is iconic about a champ, so they end up with a different feel to them. They're also based off translated data from multiple languages, so there's some non english speaking memeing going on there too (e.g. 'Science'), compared to the previous set that were just based off english survey responses.

https://imgur.com/a/ZC4wB

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Urgot**

Almost all the champion changes in 7.22 are adjustments due to the impact of the new Runes system. One champ who's getting some other work on top of that though is Urgot. We had some Urgot buffs in 7.21 and, while we liked the direction of them, looks like they went a bit far. We'll probably be increasing the delay on Urgot's Q a bit as a result, making it a bit more dodgeable. It'll still be significantly faster than pre-7.21, but not quite as reliable as at present (currently testing 0.5s -> 0.6s, was 0.85s previously). Urgot might still be too strong after that changes, we'll wait and see where pre-season puts him though before considering raw power, rather than timing, changes though.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**What do you want to see more of in these posts?**

I figure it's good to ask this every so often, and now's a good time since there's a bit less to discuss today given we've talked so much about pre-season already. So, what would you like to see more of in these posts? 

A few notes: 

* I'm not gonna leak upcoming skins, champions, features etc.
* I work with the teams that work on the in game gameplay experiences (champions, items, balance, gold income, the jungle, UI like healthbar etc). The further something is from that the less likely it is I'll be able to answer usefully. I'm not going to be able to respond too effectively for example to discussion around how matchmaking works, what's up with Chat Bans, how you earn Chests/Keys etc.
* These posts get written a couple of days in advance so they can get translated into other languages, so anything really recent as a topic will need to get covered in the comments instead (or the next post). 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------


http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/6.24.1/img/champion/Ziggs.png

So Swain, Yasuo (how the fuck does science go in there?), Anivia, Lux, Draven and Ezreal.

What's the one for Viktor look like? When I think Viktor, I think about his waveclear, but lately there's been numerous champions who can wave clear much sooner and with much less mana costs. Are there any plans to look at old Vik again?

Turns out 'Science' is a translation of a Korean meme. As I understand it goes along the lines of 'it's scientifically guaranteed that the Yasuo on your team will be terrible and feed, while the Yasuo on their team will be pentakilling constantly'. Or something like that anyway. Basically the equivalent of the 'Our Shaco/Their Shaco' meme.

Basically adding an earlier pseudo last hit threshold? Some of the issues I'd expect to run into:

* Accidental triggers by other positions (e.g. an ADC trying to push)
* Friction between team mates over when to wait, when to AA, whether not a minion has already been half CS'd (could solve with VFX, that does increase visual noise/complexity though)
* A negative experience for people drawn to support because they either don't like last hitting, or sometimes want a different play experience
* A lower action duo lane because both players on each side now need to spend significant amounts of time CSing (at present supports have a lot of free time to harass/threaten to harass).
* Roaming to be much more costly, and done less as a result. 

I think it's a cool question, and finding interactive/skill testing ways to give supports income makes a lot of sense, I'd be doubtful about this particular approach though.
That makes sense. Thanks for your response.

What are some specific issues with Swain and Irelia that you're trying to address with their reworks?

Irelia - Biggest thing here is huge untapped potential, there's a lot more that could be done with telekinetic blade control. Secondary goals of modernization (she's starting to show her age noticeably), addressing lack of clarity/sometimes fairness around when the stun procs, an ult that's as satisfying as it is strong, more distinction from other similar fighters.

Swain - Less stat checking drain tanking, clearer and more satisfying high moments, clearer thematic (he's pretty scattered at present), modernization again, better recognizing his position in Noxus.

Without wanting to sound too mean, can you give a bit of insight into how "untapped potential" and "more satisfying high moments" take rework-priority over extremely problematic kits? It is hard to see legitimation for direct-work postponement spanning over probably years for long-overdue champions like Aatrox or Nunu, mobility-crept champs like Fiddlesticks and the balance-philosophy-wise doomed Shaco just because there are better ideas for approaches on less problematic champions. 

Are these concrete ideas really able to shift champion redesign-focus around in such a big fashion?

Quick Little Reminder: Aatrox is currently having work done on him with a full Gameplay update that, while it isn't fully solidified, is being thought about and worked on. With more work coming after Pre-Season is in full motion and balanced (to the best it can be).

I think we have to remember that while Champs like Nunu and Fiddle have not been announced in a "Champion Road Map", they are constantly sitting in Rioter's minds and being thought about while other announced champs are being worked on and then those ideas are being brought up when ideation starts. Remember that ideation is a lot of ideas being thrown out for multiple champs and then when they stumble across a solid idea for a champ that needs work (taken from the list of champs in need of work, NOT JUST ANY CHAMP) they then move on to the actual work. 

There is no purposeful neglect or postponing of champions because the want to see Nunu struggle or because they love Irelia more. I would argue there isn't any neglect at all. They just haven't found a solid route they want to take Nunu or Fiddle yet, but have a solid route for Irelia. AGAIN, they are always thinking about where to take champions in a rework. 

Would you rather see Fiddle or Nunu (who while struggle, can find success) with broken, in-cohesive kits that disconnect from the champions' identities, don't work, make multiple Aatrox situations, or just SUCK more than they do now? Simply because you want them now, ASAP or you feel they need more work than Irelia or Swain. I would argue that Quality out-weighs Perceived Urgency and that Urgency is a factor that isn't ignored.

Any thoughts on Zyra?

Meddler mentioned a few weeks back that they'll be looking into adding a last-hit interaction to help her in mid lane.

The consensus seems to be that Zyra will be on the list of champs they're watching after the Reforged patch. I'm nervous about that because she (and low play rate champs in general) don't get a lot of attention. It could be weeks or months before she gets buffed after the rune patch.

Mostly, I don't have a lot of confidence about this because Riot doesn't seem to appreciate how much mpen matters to Zyra's power throughout the game. It's not going to be easy to restore her power curve with flat damage buffs, if it's actually possible at all. 

My biggest fear is that they take a "wait and see" approach, and 6 months later I'm still here spamming dev threads about Zyra.
